newsitem.title: USA: MGM, Metromedia hammer out $550 mln deal - Variety.
newsitem.headline: MGM, Metromedia hammer out $550 mln deal - Variety.

text.p: An agreement in principle has been worked out to sell Metromedia Entertainment Group's Orion Pictures and Goldwyn Entertainment assets to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Inc, Daily Variety said on Thursday.
According to sources close to both companies, the deal was said to be for about $550 million in a complex arrangement including assumption of debt, notes and cash, Variety said.
Both sides were quoted as declining to comment.
Sources said notes would not be issued by MGM, indicating MGM co-owner and Tracinda Corp chief Kirk Kerkorian could be financing the purchase, Variety reported.
Other sources familiar with the talks have told Reuters Metromedia is in talks with MGM and Kerkorian regarding the sale of Metromedia's film library to MGM.
They said they believed MGM and Kerkorian had made a preliminary bid just above $300 million for Metromedia's 2,200-title catalog.
Analysts have also said Metromedia's entertainment assets could fetch between $500 million and $650 million.
Variety said Metromedia's Landmark arthouse theater group was not part of the deal and would be sold later.
